member.name: T:Devart.Common.DbConnectionBase
member.summary: Represents an open connection to a server.

member.name: M:Devart.Common.DbConnectionBase.BeginOpen(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts an asynchronous invocation of an method.
member.param: The delegate to call when the asynchronous invoke is complete. If callback is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the delegate is not called.
State information that is passed on to the delegate.
member.returns: An interface that represents the asynchronous operation started by calling this method.

member.summary: Changes the current database associated with an open .
member.param: The database name.

member.name: M:Devart.Common.DbConnectionBase.Close()
member.summary: Closes the connection to the database. This is the preferred method of closing any open connection.

member.name: P:Devart.Common.DbConnectionBase.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a server connection.
member.value: The connection string that includes the source database name, and other parameters needed to establish the initial connection. The default value is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:Devart.Common.DbConnectionBase.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time to wait while trying to establish a connection before terminating the attempt and generating an error.
member.value: The time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to open. The default value is 15 seconds.

member.name: P:Devart.Common.DbConnectionBase.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the server to which to connect.
member.value: Gets or sets name of the server to which to connect. The default value is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:Devart.Common.DbConnectionBase.Database
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the current database or the database to be used once a connection is open.
member.value: The name of the current database or the name of the database to be used once a connection is open. The default value is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleCommand.CommandText
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL or PL/SQL statement or stored procedure to execute against the Oracle database.
member.value:
The SQL statement or stored procedure to execute. The default value is an empty string ("").
When working with overloaded stored procedures, use following syntax for executing specific overloaded routine: "StoredProcName:1" or "StoredProcName:5". First example executes first overloaded stored procedure, while second example executes fifth overloaded procedure. This notation affects only describing procedures in is .

member.summary: A collection of user sessions that are grouped together based on their processing needs. When a session is created, it is automatically mapped to a consumer group based on mapping rules that you have set up.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.EvaluationContext
member.summary: A database object that defines external data that can be referenced in rule conditions. The external data can exist as variables, table data, or both.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Function
member.summary: A schema object, similar to a procedure, that always returns a single value.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Index
member.summary: Index is a schema object that contains an entry for each indexed row of the table or table cluster and provide direct, fast access to rows. Oracle Database supports several types of index. An index-organized table is a table in which the data is stored in an index structure.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Library
member.summary: A schema object associated with an operating-system shared library. The name of this schema object can then be used in the call_spec of CREATE FUNCTION or CREATE PROCEDURE statements, or when declaring a function or procedure in a package or type, so that SQL and PL/SQL can call to third-generation-language (3GL) functions and procedures.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Lob
member.summary: Large object. An Oracle data type designed to hold large amounts of data.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Operator
member.summary: An Oracle structure that represents user-defined operator for manipulating data items.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Package
member.summary: An encapsulated collection of related procedures, functions, and other program objects stored together in the database.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.PackageBody
member.summary: A collection of object definitions declared in a package.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Procedure
member.summary: A schema object that consists of a set of SQL statements and other PL/SQL constructs, grouped together, stored in the database, and run as a unit to solve a specific problem or perform a set of related tasks.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Synonym
member.summary: A synonym is an alias for another schema object. Because a synonym is simply an alias, it requires no storage other than its definition in the data dictionary.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Table
member.summary: Basic unit of data storage in Oracle Database. Data in tables is stored in rows and columns.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Trigger
member.summary: A PL/SQL procedure that fires when a table or view is modified or when specific user or database actions occur. Procedures are explicitly run, whereas triggers are implicitly run.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Type
member.summary: An object type, represented by varying array (varray), a nested table type, or an Oracle object type.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.TypeBody
member.summary: A container for the member methods defined in the object type specification.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.Unknown
member.summary: Object type is not defined.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleObjectType.View
member.summary: A customized presentation of data in one or more tables or other views. You can think of it as of stored query. View does not actually contain data.

member.summary: Adds a subscriber to the queue.
member.param: Agent on whose behalf the subscription is being defined.
member.overloads: Adds a subscriber to the queue.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AddSubscriber(Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAgent,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a subscriber to the queue.
member.param: Agent on whose behalf the subscription is being defined.

A conditional expression based on the message properties, the message data properties and PL/SQL functions. A rule is specified as a Boolean expression using syntax similar to the WHERE clause of a SQL query.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AddSubscriber(Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAgent,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a subscriber to the queue.
member.param: Agent on whose behalf the subscription is being defined.

A conditional expression based on the message properties, the message data properties and PL/SQL functions. A rule is specified as a Boolean expression using syntax similar to the WHERE clause of a SQL query.

Specifies a transformation that will be applied when this subscriber dequeues the message. The source type of the transformation must match the type of the queue. If the subscriber is remote, the transformation is applied before propagation to the remote queue.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AddSubscriber(Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAgent,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a subscriber to the queue.
member.param: Agent on whose behalf the subscription is being defined.

A conditional expression based on the message properties, the message data properties and PL/SQL functions. A rule is specified as a Boolean expression using syntax similar to the WHERE clause of a SQL query.

Specifies a transformation that will be applied when this subscriber dequeues the message. The source type of the transformation must match the type of the queue. If the subscriber is remote, the transformation is applied before propagation to the remote queue.
If TRUE, propagation is from queue to queue. Supported only in Oracle 10.2 and greater.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AddSubscriber(Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAgent,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueDeliveryMode)
member.summary: Adds a subscriber to the queue.
member.param: Agent on whose behalf the subscription is being defined.

A conditional expression based on the message properties, the message data properties and PL/SQL functions. A rule is specified as a Boolean expression using syntax similar to the WHERE clause of a SQL query.

Specifies a transformation that will be applied when this subscriber dequeues the message. The source type of the transformation must match the type of the queue. If the subscriber is remote, the transformation is applied before propagation to the remote queue.
If TRUE, propagation is from queue to queue. Supported only in Oracle 10.2 and greater.
Delivery mode of the messages the subscriber is interested in. Supported only in Oracle 10.2 and higher.

member.summary: Sets the property of .
member.param: The number of times a dequeue with the OracleQueueDequeueMode.Remove mode can be attempted on a message.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AlterPropagationSchedule(System.String,System.Double,System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Alters parameters of the schedule by which messages are propagated.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, then the default domain name is used.
Duration of the propagation window in seconds.
Date function to compute the start of the next propagation window from the end of the current window. If this value is NULL, propagation is stopped at the end of the current window.
Maximum wait, in seconds, in the propagation window for a message to be propagated after it is enqueued.
member.overloads: Alters parameters of the schedule by which messages are propagated.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AlterPropagationSchedule(System.String,System.Double,System.String,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Alters parameters of the schedule by which messages are propagated.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, the default domain name is used.
Duration of the propagation window in seconds.
Date function to compute the start of the next propagation window from the end of the current window. If this value is NULL, propagation is stopped at the end of the current window.
Maximum wait, in seconds, in the propagation window for a message to be propagated after it is enqueued.
Name of the target queue to which messages are to be propagated in the form of a dblink.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AlterQueue(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Alters existing properties of a queue.
member.param: Limits the number of times a dequeue with OracleQueueDequeueMode.Remove mode can be attempted on a message. The maximum value of maxRetries is 2^31 -1. If this parameter less than zero, it is ignored.
Delay time in seconds before this message is scheduled for processing again after an application rollback. If this parameter less than zero, it is ignored.
Retention time in seconds for which a message is retained in the queue table after being dequeued. If this parameter less than zero, it is ignored.
User-specified description of the queue. If this parameter is null or is string.Empty, it is ignored.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AlterRetentionTime(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the property of ..
member.param: Number of seconds for which a message is retained in the queue table after being dequeued from the queue. 0 for no retention.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.AlterRetryDelay(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the property of ..
member.param: Delay time, in seconds, before this message is scheduled for processing again after an application rollback. If 0, the message will be scheduled as soon as possible.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.SchedulePropagation()
member.summary: Enables propagation schedule with default parameters.
member.overloads: Schedules propagation of messages from a queue to a destination identified by a specific database link.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.SchedulePropagation(System.String)
member.summary: Enables schedule for message propagation to the specified destination.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, the default domain name is used.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.SchedulePropagation(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Enables schedule for message propagation messages to the specified destination starting at the specified time.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, the default domain name is used.
Initial start time for the propagation window for messages from the source queue to the destination.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.SchedulePropagation(System.String,System.DateTime,System.Double)
member.summary: Enables schedule for message propagation to the specified destination within the specified period.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, the default domain name is used.
Initial start time for the propagation window for messages from the source queue to the destination.
Duration of the propagation window in seconds. A negative value means the propagation window is forever or until the propagation is unscheduled.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.SchedulePropagation(System.String,System.DateTime,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Enables schedule for message propagation with the specified options.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, the default domain name is used.
Initial start time for the propagation window for messages from the source queue to the destination.
Duration of the propagation window in seconds. A negative value means the propagation window is forever or until the propagation is unscheduled.
Date function to compute the start of the next propagation window from the end of the current window. If this value is null, propagation is stopped at the end of the current window.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.SchedulePropagation(System.String,System.DateTime,System.Double,System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Enables schedule for message propagation with the specified options.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, the default domain name is used.
Initial start time for the propagation window for messages from the source queue to the destination.
Duration of the propagation window in seconds. A negative value means the propagation window is forever or until the propagation is unscheduled.
Date function to compute the start of the next propagation window from the end of the current window. If this value is null, propagation is stopped at the end of the current window.
Maximum wait, in seconds, in the propagation window for a message to be propagated after it is enqueued. If this value is negative or not set, the default value is 60.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueAdmin.SchedulePropagation(System.String,System.DateTime,System.Double,System.String,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Enables schedule for message propagation with the specified options.
member.param: Destination database link. Messages in the source queue for recipients at this destination are propagated. If it is NULL, the destination is the local database and messages are propagated to other queues in the local database. The length of this field is currently limited to 128 bytes, and if the name is not fully qualified, the default domain name is used.
Initial start time for the propagation window for messages from the source queue to the destination.
Duration of the propagation window in seconds. A negative value means the propagation window is forever or until the propagation is unscheduled.
Date function to compute the start of the next propagation window from the end of the current window. If this value is null, propagation is stopped at the end of the current window.
Maximum wait, in seconds, in the propagation window for a message to be propagated after it is enqueued. If this value is negative or not set, the default value is 60.
The name of the target queue to which messages are to be propagated in the form of a dblink.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueNavigation
member.summary: Specifies which message will be dequeued next.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueNavigation.FirstMessage
member.summary: Retrieves the first message which is available and matches the search criteria. This setting resets the position to the beginning of the queue.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueNavigation.FirstMessageMultiGroup
member.summary: Indicates that a call to DequeueArray will reset the position to the beginning of the queue and dequeue messages (possibly across different transaction groups) that are available and match the search criteria, until reaching the array length limit. (Supported in Oracle server 10g and greater.)

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueNavigation.NextMessage
member.summary: Retrieve the next message that is available and matches the search criteria. If the previous message belongs to a message group, AQ retrieves the next available message that matches the search criteria and belongs to the message group.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueNavigation.NextMessageMultiGroup
member.summary: Indicates that a call to DequeueArray will dequeue the next set of messages (possibly across different transaction groups) that are available and match the search criteria, until reaching the array length limit. (Supported in Oracle server 10g and greater.)

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueNavigation.NextTransaction
member.summary: Skip the remainder of the current transaction group (if any) and retrieve the first message of the next transaction group. This setting can only be used if message grouping is enabled for the current queue.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueNavigation.Unknown
member.summary: The next dequeud message is not specified.

member.summary: The message is enqueued ahead of the message specified by OracleQueueEnqueueOptions.RelativeMessageId.

member.summary: Sort by enqueue time and then by priority.

member.summary: Sort by priority.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueSortOrder.PriorityEnqueueTime

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueSystemPrivilege.DequeueAny
member.summary: Means users granted this privilege are allowed to dequeue messages from any queues in the database.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueSystemPrivilege.EnqueueAny
member.summary: Means users granted this privilege are allowed to enqueue messages to any queues in the database.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueSystemPrivilege.ManageAny
member.summary: Means users granted this privilege are allowed to run OracleQueueAdmin methods calls on any schemas in the database.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueSystemPrivilege.Unknown
member.summary: The system privilege is not specified.

member.summary: Purges messages from queue tables.
member.overloads: Purges messages from queue tables. You can perform various purge operations on both single-consumer and multiconsumer queue tables for persistent queues.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueTable.PurgeQueueTable(System.String)
member.summary: Purges messages from queue tables.
member.param: Specifies the purge condition to use when purging the queue table. The purge condition must be in the format of a SQL WHERE clause, and it is case-sensitive. The condition is based on the columns of aq$queue_table view.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueTable.PurgeQueueTable(System.String,Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueDeliveryMode)
member.summary: Purges messages from queue tables.
member.param: Specifies the purge condition to use when purging the queue table. The purge condition must be in the format of a SQL WHERE clause, and it is case-sensitive. The condition is based on the columns of aq$queue_table view.

This parameter is used to specify delivery mode of messages are to be purged. You cannot implement arbitrary purge conditions if buffered messages have to be purged. (Used in Oracle Server 10.2 only.)

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueTable.PurgeQueueTable(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Purges messages from queue tables.
member.param: Specifies the purge condition to use when purging the queue table. The purge condition must be in the format of a SQL WHERE clause, and it is case-sensitive. The condition is based on the columns of aq$queue_table view.

If block is , then an exclusive lock on all the queues in the queue table is held while purging the queue table. This will cause concurrent enqueuers and dequeuers to block while the queue table is purged. The purge call always succeeds if block is . This will not block enqueuers and dequeuers, but it can cause the purge to fail with an error during high concurrency times.

member.name: M:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueTable.PurgeQueueTable(System.String,System.Boolean,Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueDeliveryMode)
member.summary: Purges messages from queue tables.
member.param: Specifies the purge condition to use when purging the queue table. The purge condition must be in the format of a SQL WHERE clause, and it is case-sensitive. The condition is based on the columns of aq$queue_table view.

If block is , then an exclusive lock on all the queues in the queue table is held while purging the queue table. This will cause concurrent enqueuers and dequeuers to block while the queue table is purged. The purge call always succeeds if block is . This will not block enqueuers and dequeuers, but it can cause the purge to fail with an error during high concurrency times.

This parameter is used to specify delivery mode of messages are to be purged. You cannot implement arbitrary purge conditions if buffered messages have to be purged. (Used in Oracle Server 10.2 only.)

Specifies which properties are used to order messages in the queue. Default value is Ascending.
Specifies whether the queues created in the table can have multiple consumers.
Specifies the message grouping behaviour.
The user-defined description of the table.
The lowest database version with which the queue is compatible.
The primary Oracle instance which will be used to operate the table. 0 to use any available instance.
The secondary Oracle instance which will be used to operate the table when the primary instance is unavailable. 0 to use any available instance.
Specifies whether the queue table is used for secure queues. If , AQ agents must be associated explicitly with one or more database users who can perform queue operations, such as enqueue or dequeue.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueTableOptions.PrimaryInstance
member.summary: The primary owner of the queue table. Queue monitor scheduling and propagation for the queues in the queue table are done in this instance. The default value for primary instance is 0, which means queue monitor scheduling and propagation will be done in any available instance.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.Oracle.OracleQueueTableOptions.SecondaryInstance
member.summary: The queue table fails over to the secondary instance if the primary instance is not available. The default value is 0, which means that the queue table will fail over to any available instance.

member.summary: Trace all lines.

member.summary: Trace all SQL executions.

member.summary: Trace calls to enabled PL/SQL units only.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.Oracle.ReadLobMode
member.summary: Determines how LOB data is fetched and represented.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.ReadLobMode.CachedDirect
member.summary: LOB objects are treated as instances , fetched immediately, and stored in cache, so on consequent data fetch operations the LOB object will not be requested again from the server.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.ReadLobMode.Deferred
member.summary: LOB objects are treated as instances . The actual LOB data is fetched only when the field value is requested. The cache is not used.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.ReadLobMode.DefferedCachedDirect
member.summary: LOB objects are treated as instances . The actual LOB data is fetched only when the field value is requested. The cache is used.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.ReadLobMode.Direct
member.summary: LOB objects are treated as instances , and fetched immediately. The cache is not used, so on consequent data fetch operations the LOB object will be read again from the server.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.ReadLobMode.Value
member.summary: LOB objects are treated as byte arrays or strings, and fetched immediately.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType
member.summary: Describes type of SQL*Plus command. Unless the corresponding SQL*Plus command name is explicitly specified, it coincides with the enumeration member's title. The functionality of corresponding commands in SQL*Plus is given below.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Accept
member.summary: Represents the ACCEPT SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command reads a line of input and stores it in a given user variable.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Append
member.summary: Represents the APPEND SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command adds specified text to the end of the current line in the buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Archive
member.summary: Represents the ARCHIVE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command starts or stops the automatic archiving of online redo log files, manually (explicitly) archives specified redo log files, or displays information about redo log files.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Attribute
member.summary: Represents the ATTRIBUTE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command specifies display characteristics for a given attribute of an Object Type column, and lists the current display characteristics for a single attribute or all attributes.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Break
member.summary: Represents the BREAK SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command specifies where and how formatting will change in a report, or lists the current break definition.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Btitle
member.summary: Represents the BTITLE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command places and formats a specified title at the bottom of each report page, or lists the current BTITLE definition.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Change
member.summary: Represents the CHANGE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command changes text on the current line in the buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Clear
member.summary: Represents the CLEAR SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command resets or erases the current clause or setting for the specified option, such as BREAKS or COLUMNS.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Column
member.summary: Represents the COLUMN SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command specifies display characteristics for a given column, or lists the current display characteristics for a single column or for all columns.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Compute
member.summary: Represents the COMPUTE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command calculates and prints summary lines, using various standard computations, on subsets of selected rows, or lists all COMPUTE definitions.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Connect
member.summary: Represents the CONNECT SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command connects a given user to Oracle.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Copy
member.summary: Represents the COPY SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command copies results from a query to a table in a local or remote database.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Define
member.summary: Represents the DEFINE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command specifies a user variable and assigns it a CHAR value, or lists the value and variable type of a single variable or all variables.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Del
member.summary: Represents the DEL SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command deletes one or more lines of the buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Describe
member.summary: Represents the DESCRIBE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command lists the column definitions for the specified table, view, or synonym or the specifications for the specified function or procedure.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Disconnect
member.summary: Represents the DISCONNECT SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command commits pending changes to the database and logs the current user off Oracle, but does not exit SQL*Plus.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Edit
member.summary: Represents the EDIT SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command invokes a host operating system text editor on the contents of the specified file or on the contents of the buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Execute
member.summary: Represents the EXECUTE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command executes a single PL/SQL statement.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Get
member.summary: Represents the GET SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command loads a host operating system file into the SQL buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Help
member.summary: Represents the HELP SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command accesses the SQL*Plus help system.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Host
member.summary: Represents the HOST SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command executes a host operating system command without leaving SQL*Plus.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Input
member.summary: Represents the INPUT SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command adds one or more new lines after the current line in the buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.List
member.summary: Represents the LIST SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command lists one or more lines of the SQL buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Password
member.summary: Represents the PASSWORD SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command allows a password to be changed without echoing the password on an input device.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Pause
member.summary: Represents the PAUSE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command displays the specified text, then waits for the user to press Return.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Print
member.summary: Represents the PRINT SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command displays the current value of a bind variable.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Prompt
member.summary: Represents the PROMPT SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command sends the specified message to the user's screen.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Quit
member.summary: Represents the QUIT SQL*Plus command. This command terminates SQL*Plus and returns control to the operating system.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Recover
member.summary: Represents the RECOVER SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command performs media recovery on one or more tablespaces, one or more datafiles, or the entire database.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Remark
member.summary: Represents the REMARK SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command begins a comment in a script.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Repfooter
member.summary: Represents the REPFOOTER SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command places and formats a specified report footer at the bottom of each report, or lists the current REPFOOTER definition.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Repheader
member.summary: Represents the REPHEADER SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command pRepresents the APPEND SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Run
member.summary: Represents the RUN SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command lists and executes the SQL command or PL/SQL block currently stored in the SQL buffer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Save
member.summary: Represents the SAVE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command saves the contents of the SQL buffer in a host operating system file (a script).

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Set
member.summary: Represents the SET SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command sets a system variable to alter the SQL*Plus environment for your current session.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Show
member.summary: Represents the SHOW SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command shows the value of a SQL*Plus system variable or the current SQL*Plus environment.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Shutdown
member.summary: Represents the SHUTDOWN SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command shuts down a currently running Oracle instance.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Spool
member.summary: Represents the SPOOL SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command stores query results in an operating system file and, optionally, sends the file to a printer.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Start
member.summary: Represents the START SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command executes the contents of the specified script. The script can only be called from a url.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.StartEx
member.summary: Represents the @@ SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command runs a script; looks for the specified script in the same path as the script from which it was called.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Startup
member.summary: Represents the STARTUP SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command starts an Oracle instance and optionally mounts and opens a database.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Store
member.summary: Represents the STORE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command saves attributes of the current SQL*Plus environment in a host operating system file (a script).

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Timing
member.summary: Represents the TIMING SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command records timing data for an elapsed period of time, lists the current timer's title and timing data, or lists the number of active timers.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Ttitle
member.summary: Represents the TTITLE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command places and formats a specified title at the top of each report page, or lists the current TTITLE definition.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Undefine
member.summary: Represents the UNDEFINE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command deletes one or more user variables that you defined either explicitly (with the DEFINE command) or implicitly (with an argument to the START command).

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Unknown
member.summary: The SQL*Plus command type is not set.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Variable
member.summary: Represents the VARIABLE SQL*Plus command. In SQL*Plus this command declares a bind variable that can be referenced in PL/SQL.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.Oracle.SqlPlusStatementType.Whenever
member.summary: Represents the "WHENEVER OSERROR" or "WHENEVER SQLERROR" SQL*Plus command. This command exits SQL*Plus if either an operating system command or SQL command or PL/SQL block generates an error.
